question.title: Why does this substitution not work with HOCON
question.body:
I am trying to use a HOCON config & the include keyword to be able to overwrite environment variables when running a java server locally. File structure looks like this

local.conf

include "app.conf"

app.conf

z {
  useSecret: ${SECRET}
}

Can overwrite this environment variable from the same file no problem

app.conf

SECRET: "fooBar"
z {
  useSecret: ${SECRET}
}

But from a different file it generates a Could not resolve substitution to a value: ${SECRET}

local.conf

SECRET: "fooBar"
include "app.conf"

app.conf

z {
  useSecret: ${SECRET}
}

What am I doing wrong?
